headline.print_headline: Vital Signs | Childbirth: Method of Delivery May Affect Obesity Risk
headline.main: Method of Delivery May Affect Obesity Risk

docs.abstract: A study found that children born by Caesarean section were more likely to be obese by age 3. Whether the Caesarean was planned or an emergency delivery made no difference.
docs.snippet: A study found that children born by Caesarean section were more likely to be obese by age 3. Whether the Caesarean was planned or an emergency delivery made no difference.

headline.main: Taking Calcium May Pose Heart Risks

docs.abstract: In a large European study, people who were taking calcium supplements had nearly a 30 percent greater risk of heart attack over four years than those who were not.
docs.snippet: In a large European study, people who were taking calcium supplements had nearly a 30 percent greater risk of heart attack over four years than those who were not.

headline.seo: FreshDirect Expands Delivery to All Parts of the Bronx
headline.print_headline: FreshDirect Expands Delivery to Serve All of the Bronx
headline.main: FreshDirect Expands Delivery to Serve All of the Bronx

docs.abstract: FreshDirect expands its delivery to serve all of the Bronx, drawing mixed reactions from residents who say they cannot afford FreshDirect prices and from community advocates who say that any benefit will be outweighed by more truck traffic and exhaust fumes.
docs.lead_paragraph: A move hailed by city leaders is criticized by some who say they cannot afford FreshDirect prices, and others who say it means more truck traffic.
docs.snippet: A move hailed by city leaders is criticized by some who say they cannot afford FreshDirect prices, and others who say it means more truck traffic.

headline.main: Education and Prevention: Creating Public Service Campaigns About Type 2 Diabetes

byline.original: By JENNIFER CUTRARO and KATHERINE SCHULTEN

docs.abstract: In this lesson, students read about a new study showing a rise in Type 2 diabetes among adolescents, learn more about its causes, and develop a public awareness campaign to promote education and prevention.
docs.snippet: In this lesson, students read about a new study showing a rise in Type 2 diabetes among adolescents, learn more about its causes, and develop a public awareness campaign to promote education and prevention.

headline.print_headline: A Long View on Health Care: Think Like an Investor
headline.main: A Long View on Health Care: Think Like an Investor

docs.abstract: Interview with economist Dana Goldman, who believes that preventive care should drive health care reimbursement.
docs.lead_paragraph: A conversation with the economist Dana Goldman, who believes that prevention should drive health care reimbursement.
docs.snippet: A conversation with the economist Dana Goldman, who believes that prevention should drive health care reimbursement.

headline.main: Sleep Apnea Is Linked to a Higher Risk for Cancer

docs.abstract: Report by researchers at the University of Wisconsin School of Medicine and Public Health, alongside separate study by the Spanish Sleep Network, finds that people with sleep apnea have a higher risk of cancer. Photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Two new studies have found that people with sleep apnea, a common disorder that causes snoring, fatigue and dangerous pauses in breathing at night, have a higher risk of cancer. The new research marks the first time that sleep apnea has been linked to cancer in humans. About 28 million Americans have some form of sleep apnea, though many cases go undiagnosed. For sleep doctors, the condition is a top concern because it deprives the body of oxygen at night and often coincides with cardiovascular disease, obesity and diabetes.
docs.snippet: Two new studies have found that people with sleep apnea, a common disorder that causes snoring, fatigue and dangerous pauses in breathing at night, have a higher risk of cancer. The new research marks the first time that sleep apnea has been linked...
